articles.title: Matthew Jiwa
articles.contents:
Matthew Jiwa
          
          
          Home
          Publications
          CV
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Matthew Jiwa
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        LinkedIn
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Twitter
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Email
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            I’m a PhD candidate at the University of Melbourne
            studying the contextual factors and characteristics of
            information that drive us to seek it.
            There are a lot of questions surrounding our consumption
            of information that we don’t fully understand:
            Why do we tend to prefer information that supports
            our existing beliefs?
            How can we make accurate information more
            desirable?
            How can we limit the spread of misinformation and
            disinformation online?
            These are a few examples of the questions that guide my
            research interests. I combine experimental design from
            cognitive psychology with computational modelling to address
            these questions.
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Matthew Jiwa

Contents

Conference
Presentations & Workshops

Jiwa, M., Cooper, P. S., Chong, T. T. J., &
Bode, S. (2021). Choosing increases the value of non- instrumental
information. Scientific reports, 11(1), 1-11. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-021-88031-y
Feuerriegel, D., Jiwa, M., Turner, W. F.,
Andrejević, M., Hester, R., & Bode, S. (2021). Tracking dynamic
adjustments to decision making and performance monitoring processes in
conflict tasks. NeuroImage, 238, 118265. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neuroimage.2021.118265
Jiwa, M. W., & Jiwa, M. (2020). Why the
effectiveness of a face mask is not limited to its infection control.
The Journal of Health Design, 5(3). https://doi.org/10.21853/JHD.2020.117
In preparation
Jiwa, M., Cooper, P. S., Chong, T. T. J., &
Bode, S. (2022). Hedonism as a Motive for Information Search – Biased
Information-Seeking Leads to Biased Beliefs. Decision Science Hub
seminar series, The University of Melbourne, Australia.
Conference Presentations
& Workshops






Jiwa, M., Cooper, P. S., Chong, T. T. J., &
Bode, S. (2021). Choosing Increases the Value of Non- Instrumental
Information. Australasian Cognitive Neuroscience Society Conference, The

Jiwa, M., Cooper, P. S., Chong, T. T. J., &
Bode, S. (2021). Choosing Increases the Value of Non- Instrumental
